title: So how come TF has the second highest ban rate in Korea?
body:
Pretty much the title, I'm just wondering I couldn't really think of anything besides his roam potential.

Source: http://www.lolking.net/charts?region=kr&type=bans&range=weekly&map=sr&queue=1x1&league=ranked

Edit: We he's third now last time I checked he was second.

replies.body:
Global pressure he brings with TP is pretty insane at higher Elo. Like Shen, but he actually does damage. 

At lower elo's, he's just free kills most of time.
Silver TF ults are designed to make the enemy team laugh so hard they miss cs

> [{quoted}](name=Uiraya,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mTd61IWA,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-11-22T18:34:05.857+0000)
>
> Silver TF ults are designed to make the enemy team laugh so hard they miss cs

I laughed harder then I should have to be honest. It's true though.
Ahh thanks for the info. Guess I was kind of right about his roam potential.
Because his yellow card displeases the great leader.  Any ganks will be met with merciless attacks.
Because most Korean's actually know how to play him well.
Second best roamer in a early  game focused meta.

Wave clear, point and click low CD stun, global pressure.

A good TF is total aids to play against.
where there is a higher sense of coordination and teamplay, people like Rek'Sai, Shen and Twisted Fate are far more valuable
Because global presence is fucking nonsense. Combine that with a target stun and it's just ridiculously stupid
Snowball side-lanes in a snowball meta makes sense.
Have you seen a High Elo Korean TF Main?

Him being a champion that is designed to stop funny business and aid snowballing in a preseason that focuses on snowballing... means that he's in a nice spot. 
Also I can't imagine how a TF could get 45% CDR, but I saw it once and it looked like he didn't have any cooldowns at all. I found it really scary.

Obvious playmaking potential.

Strong waveclear.

The power of his rather spammable point and click 2 second gold card stun carries his weight rather well in teamfights.

As a whole package he provides a lot to the team after the early parts of his passive laning phase.
